content:
French press is a great brewing method, but espresso machines can definitely bring out a different level of flavor and complexity in your coffee.

If you're considering getting an espresso machine, you'll want to think about the type of machine that fits your needs and budget. There are manual, semi-automatic, and automatic machines, each with their own pros and cons.

Manual machines, like a manual lever or piston-driven machine, can offer a high degree of control and a more traditional espresso experience. Semi-automatic machines, like a pump-driven machine, can offer a good balance between convenience and control. Automatic machines, like a super-automatic or capsule machine, can offer ease of use and convenience, but may lack some control over the brewing process.

When it comes to flavor, espresso machines can bring out more nuances in the coffee due to the high pressure and temperature involved in the brewing process. This can result in a more concentrated and rich flavor profile compared to French press or drip brewing.

It's great that you've been ordering from an online retailer with a good selection of single-origin roasts. When you get an espresso machine, you may want to experiment with different roasts and brewing techniques to find the perfect combination for your taste.
